segments.en: Maybe they have a guard, but they're not supposed to talk to journalists or friends of the defendant or anyone because their decision is supposed to be pure.
segments.cn: 也许他们有一个警卫，但他们不应该与记者或被告的朋友或任何人交谈，因为他们的决定应该是纯粹的。

segments.en: So they talk, and sometimes it takes 10 minutes.
segments.cn: 所以他们会交谈，有时需要10分钟。

segments.en: Everyone agrees this person is guilty, or this person is innocent, but sometimes they don't agree.
segments.cn: 每个人都同意这个人有罪，或者这个人是无辜的，但有时他们不同意。

segments.en: And it can be one day, two days, a week, two weeks, a month trying to decide what to do.
segments.cn: 可能需要一天，两天，一周，两周，一个月来决定该怎么办。

segments.en: I remember in the O.J.
Simpson case, the jury took a long time to figure out what they were going to do.
segments.cn: 辛普森案中，陪审团花了很长时间来决定他们要怎么做。

segments.en: Now, we said that the jury are common citizens.
segments.cn: 现在，我们说陪审团是普通公民。

segments.en: They're normal people.
So what happens in their jobs, like if they can't go to work because they're doing this?
segments.cn: 那么在他们的工作中会发生什么，比如如果他们因为这个不能去工作？

segments.en: Well, in America, this job is called jury duty.
segments.cn: 好吧，在美国，这个工作叫做陪审团职责。

segments.en: And so someone will send you a letter, and they say, listen, you need to come do jury duty, and you help be a part of the jury.
segments.cn: 所以有人会给你发一封信，他们会说，听着，你需要来履行陪审团职责，帮助成为陪审团的一部分。

segments.en: And your your job, they can't make you come because this is a service for the government.
segments.cn: 而你的工作，他们不能强迫你来，因为这是为政府提供的服务。

segments.en: So it's above everything else?
segments.cn: 所以这比其他一切都重要？

segments.en: It's above.
You get your normal pay.
There's no problem.
You just don't work.
Okay, so they can't fire you if you're in jury duty for like five days or a month or whatever.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以如果你陪审义务五天或一个月，他们不能解雇你。

segments.en: No, they can't.
That's illegal.
Wow, that's really interesting.
But a lot of people I've heard don't like to go to jury duty for some reason.
segments.cn: 但我听说很多人不喜欢去陪审义务，不知道为什么。

segments.en: No, it's probably very boring.
I've never done it, but it's probably very boring.
segments.cn: 我从来没有做过，但这可能真的很无聊。

segments.en: I would imagine so.
All right, well, that's a very interesting topic.
segments.cn: 好吧，这是一个非常有趣的话题。

segments.cn: 我相信在你们的国家，法律处理得不同。
